trans-unit.source: Represents an x-, y-, and z-coordinate point in 3-D space.
In XAML, the delimiter between the values of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> can be either a comma or a space.
Some cultures might use the comma character as the decimal delimiter instead of the period character.
XAML processing for invariant culture defaults to en-US in most XAML processor implementations, and expects the period to be the decimal delimiter.

You should avoid using the comma character as the decimal delimiter if specifying a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> in XAML, because that will clash with the string type conversion of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> attribute value into its components.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
The x-coordinate of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D>.
The y-coordinate of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D>.
The z-coordinate of this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X"></xref> value of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y"></xref> value of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z"></xref> value of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.

Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> and returns the result as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
Adding a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> structure to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D> structure is prohibited.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to add.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> structure to add.
The sum of point and vector.

Determines whether the specified object is a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure and if so, whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z"></xref> properties of the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> are equal to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z"></xref> properties of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
If `o` is not a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> structure, this method returns `false`.

Because <xref:System.Double> values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> instances that are logically equal might fail.
The object to compare.
`true` if the instances are equal; otherwise, `false`.
`true` if o is a structure and if it is also identical to this structure; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structures for equality.

Because <xref:System.Double> values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> instances that are logically equal might fail.
The instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> to compare to this instance.
`true` if instances are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structures for equality.

Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> structures are equal if the values of their <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z%2A> properties are the same.

Because <xref:System.Double> values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> instances that are logically equal might fail.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if the , , and values for point1 and point2 are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
A hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure by the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to transform.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure to use for the transformation.
A transformed structure, the result of transforming point by matrix.
Translates the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure by the specified amounts.

This operation is equivalent to adding a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D> structure to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> structure with the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D.Z%2A> values.

Note that calling the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Offset%2A> method will only have an effect if you can change the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z%2A> properties directly.

Because <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> is a value type, if you reference a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> object by using a property or indexer, you get a copy of the object, not a reference to the object.

If you attempt to change <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z%2A> on a property or indexer reference, a compiler error occurs.
Similarly, calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Offset%2A> on the property or indexer will not change the underlying object.

If you want to change the value of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> that is referenced as a property or indexer, create a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D>, modify its fields, and then assign the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> back to the property or indexer.
The amount to change the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X"></xref> coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The amount to change the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y"></xref> coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The amount to change the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z"></xref> coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.

Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> and returns the result as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
Adding a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> structure to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> structure is prohibited.
The point to add.
The vector to add.
A structure that is the sum of point and vector.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structures for equality.

Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> structures are equal if the values of their <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y%2A> , and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z%2A> properties are the same.

Because <xref:System.Double> values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> instances that are logically equal might fail.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if the , , and coordinates of point1 and point2 are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structures for inequality.

Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> structures are not equal if the values of their <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z%2A> properties are different.

Because <xref:System.Double> values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D> instances that are logically equal might fail.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if the , , and coordinates of point1 and point2 are different; otherwise, `false`.
Transforms the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure by the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> structure.
The point to transform.
The matrix that is used to transform point.
The result of transforming point by using matrix.

Subtracts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure from a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure and returns the result as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure on which to perform subtraction.
The structure to subtract from point1.
A structure that represents the difference between point1 and point2.

Subtracts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> structure from a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure and returns the result as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure from which to subtract vector.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> structure to subtract from point.
The changed structure, the result of subtracting vector from point.
Converts a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of a 3-D point into the equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of the 3-D point.
The equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.

Subtracts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure from a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure and returns the result as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure to be subtracted from.
The structure to subtract from point1.
A structure that represents the difference between point1 and point2.

Subtracts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D"></xref> structure from a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure and returns the result as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The structure from which to subtract vector.
The structure to subtract from point.
The difference between point and vector.
Creates a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z"></xref> values of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
Creates a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The culture-specific formatting information.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.X"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Y"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D.Z"></xref> values of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
Gets or sets the x-coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The x-coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
Gets or sets the y-coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The y-coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
Gets or sets the z-coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
The z-coordinate of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D"></xref> structure.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.IFormattable.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)"></xref>.
The string specifying the format to use.
-or-
`null` to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref href="System.IFormattable"></xref> implementation.
The `IFormatProvider` to use to format the value.
-or-
`null` to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
A string containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.
